section.title: Introduction
section.p: This is the file system is used to access code storage on execute-in place (XIP) storage e.g. NOR flash.

section.title: Background information
section.p: This is the only file system present when the device boots-up.
It is used by the composite file system to present a single drive Z: to the file server.

section.title: ROM features
section.p: The ROM filing system provides the following features:

li.p: The only file system that is built into the file server and hence is the only one present when the device boots up.
Used to access code storage on execute in place (XIP) media.

section.title: ROM filing system limitations
section.p: The following are known limitations for the ROM filing system:

li.p: Write operations cannot be carried out with this filing system.
